scheme_name: Nagaland Stipend for Girls of Secondary Students
sub_categories: Education and training grants, fellowship, stipend
brief_description: The scheme aims to encourage girl students of class IX & X studying at Govt. High Schools & Govt. Higher Secondary Schools who belong to economically weaker families. Under this scheme, a stipend will be provided to two girls from each class, nominated by Headmaster/Principal of concerned school.
detailed_description: The scheme "Nagaland Stipend for Girls of Secondary Students" is a state-sponsored scheme launched by the Department of School Education, Government of Nagaland. The scheme aims to encourage girl students of class IX and X studying at Government High Schools (GHS) and Government Higher Secondary Schools (GHSS) who belong to economically weaker families. Under this scheme, a stipend will be provided to two girls from each class, nominated by the Headmaster or Principal of the concerned school.
benefits: Girl students receive a stipend of ₹1,000/-.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Nagaland. The applicant should be a girl student. The applicant should be studying in class IX or X. The applicant should be studying at a Government High School or Government Higher Secondary School. The applicant should belong to an economically weaker family.

steps: Eligible girl students can apply for the scheme by contacting the Principal/Headmaster, or the concerned authority at their respective school/institution.

Note: The Headmaster and Principal of Government High Schools and Government Higher Secondary Schools can nominate two girls from each class and submit along with the PCR at the end of the academic session, to the Directorate to avail the Stipend.

documents_required: Passport-size photograph Identity proof Address proof Income certificate of the parents/guardians Caste certificate (if applicable) Previous year's mark sheet Bank account details
